description: Dynamically change log level for Java workloads.

commands.name: az containerapp java logger delete
examples: az containerapp java logger delete --all -n my-containerapp -g MyResourceGroup
az containerapp java logger delete --logger-name root -n my-containerapp -g MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az containerapp java logger set
commands.summary: Create or update logger for Java workloads.
commands.syntax:
az containerapp java logger set --logger-level {debug, error, info, off, trace, warn}
                                --logger-name
                                [--ids]
                                [--name]
                                [--no-wait]
                                [--resource-group]
                                [--subscription]
examples: az containerapp java logger set --logger-name root --logger-level debug -n my-containerapp -g MyResourceGroup
az containerapp java logger set --logger-name root --logger-level info -n my-containerapp -g MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az containerapp java logger show
commands.summary: Display logger setting for Java workloads.
examples: az containerapp java logger show --all -n my-containerapp -g MyResourceGroup
az containerapp java logger show --logger-name root -n my-containerapp -g MyResourceGroup
